intro: Uvaria monopetala, commonly known as the single-petaled apple, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
